captions.text: We always thought alien life would come from space.
which is technically in space if you think about everythings in space really,
But that's not the important issue!
Giant monsters came from the ocean,
and started destroying everything in their path.
And after the UN apparently watched a ton of anime
they decided the only way to fight monsters,
was to build monsters of our own.
I say we nuke the Kaiju as soon as one as detected!
I say we build giant robots as big as Kaiju!
So we can watch them fight!
YEAH! Fantastic Idea! Please make this happen!
So we built the robots, named them Jaegers.
And now we're all kinds of famous and the earths last hope...
You know... I could just keep going with this intro,
but I mean who really thinks a 20 minute lead in to a title card makes sense?
There is still ONE thing left!
Wow!  This sword was really effective!
Why didn't we open with that?
Still, this gives me an idea.
Okay Gypsy, we got movement.  Two Kaiju coming your way.
Wow!  This is so much easier!
Make way for the cleanup crew!
Okay gang, It's clean up time!
Heads up third signature emerging from the breach!
Yeah I'd say fighting them here is much better than waiting for them to come to us.
It doesn't look as cool though.
Where's my gosh dern subscribe button?!

comments.author: MrAnimepredator

comments.text:
+hypernerd the wolverine 
*sorry for long post*

hopefully that kid becomes something great when he grows up instead of an 
office worker on edge.

or genetically manipulated super soldiers. and than put them into armor. 
give them guns size of an average man. and you can start the age of strife. 
Imperator, in quo speramus.
and actually the direct contact between mechanical parts give me an idea 
year back of how it could be used to replace missing limbs. and actually 
would not be that hard, tendons and muscles move the arm. those are easily 
done with wire and pistons. with fingers they simply get smaller. it should 
be controlled by something remaining of your arm, like tendons for example. 
sure the brain sends messages to muscles to work and so move the body. so 
the only problem comes on question how are you supposed to move it normally 
like organic arm. but human nerve system is pretty interesting for its 
electric impulses that send the messages. if this message could be directed 
to this arm and if the arm understood the message and did as commanded. the 
computer that receive these messages doesnt really have to be very big. 
size of a phone is pretty much enough power that is needed. it just have to 
be programmed to understand the message and than make the arm do as the 
message says and do multiple tasks same time. (like drawing or writing or 
even giving a finger requires multiple muscles working together) the 
message still goes down the old ways to non existing arm and the brain 
feels so called 'ghost pain' for the missing arm when the ways are cut and 
even that you understand that the arm doesnt exist no more. the brain as a 
whole does not and so it still sends messages to it. most likely the arm 
would be powered up by multiple batteries that must be loaded time to time.

so ones the arm is ready and functional, it can after that used for means 
of not just civil life, but war as well. since modification is simply done. 
belt fed gun can be attached to the end instead of a hand. simple command 
of moving fingers will cause it to fire. 'but what about the kick. doesnt 
it cause harm to the arm?' no. kick in weapons can be reduced with out it 
effecting its fire power. and so it turns badly wounded soldier into more 
lethal killing machine. you have literally created a cyborg soldier. (the 
term means more than just futuristic frankenstein monster. if you have 
hearing device implanted under your skin. that already makes you a cyborg)

after that different kind of cyborgs can be made, a super soldier with all 
limbs replaced with over sized robotic limbs supported by armor making him 
bigger than average man and giving more power than average man. this tank 
like shell will protect him from all kind of damage and not even eye holes 
are weak spots when you supply him with cameras behind bullet resistant 
glass (cameras today can be very small in size and phone cameras are 
perfect example of that even that they dont have endless amount of pixels) 
so only way to blind him would be by throwing mud on its face. that is if 
one even can get that close with out being shot or simply crushed or rip to 
shreds. normal weaponry for such soldier is implanted flame thrower on one 
of its arms. a machine gun (that will be now like childs toy to them) and a 
close combat weapon, possibly over sized army knife that would be like a 
sword to normal men. down sides for them can be obvious, like how are they 
supposed to live a normal life like that. well if the armor can be opened 
and the driver removed and normal sized arms and legs then implanted. they 
can continue their every day life pretty normally. it is possible that 
further fusions must be made in order to work with camera movement and the 
flame thrower and other things. but the goal is to be able to remove the 
soldier from the machine with out braking it. so might be that their back 
bone is modified with implants, same as their neck and some directly on the 
head.and of course he must have harness to hold him. cant have him just 
swinging around in there hold up by his arms and legs that could tear the 
flesh of the implant causing not just horrible pain but bleeding to death.

and suicide shock troopers can also be made. most likely made of prisoners 
either sentenced to death or life time, some pure maniacs and other insane 
scum that prisons hold in them. they can serve their country by being 
transformed. their limbs are removed through surgery and animal limb like 
implants are placed on them. after this they have hard time walking on two 
legs if it is even possible. back bag is been installed on them with 
needles to their veins (simply through bottom of the bag when its pushed 
against their back and than tied to them and locked to place) it contains 
different kind of chemical combinations from powerful adrenaline to 
hallucinogens and other things that mess up your head and turns you into 
raving beast. they are than installed with switch to turn them on and of 
(this is already done with animals like mice and moths and I think even 
with bigger animals, even with ox) another switch is been placed which 
pumps the poisons into their bodies. than last is a bomb that is activated 
when they are send to battle. this bomb is connected to their heart rate. 
ones their heart stops, either cause by them being shot or dying of the 
drugs. they will blow up causing them to be even dangerous to be killed. 
they are indeed released first on fields of war. like in cities or other 
places of major conflict. they cant separate enemy from friend ones they 
are in rage so its wise to pull your men back. these things dont have any 
piece of humanity left ones their brain is full of drugs, they are in rage 
and will quite literally rip to pieces everything they encounter. even if 
they survive the conflict, the poisons are enough to kill them causing them 
to blow up with out harm.
but just think about it. that kind of monster who makes inhuman howls 
running towards you and your friends on the field. you start shooting at it 
but it doesnt seem to have any effect. it jumps on your friend and tears 
his throat open with its mouth before turning its insane gaze on you and 
attacking in rage. you shoot at it causing it to fall dead. but instead of 
laying there, in mere seconds it will blow up in a big fire ball consuming 
you and your friends and you die instantly. named these things after what 
inspired them; Arco-flagellant.
'but isnt it waste of technology to make them' ones the technology is in 
use there will be no such thing as wasting it since it can be created all 
the time. only thing it wastes are parts of the robotics. no human lives 
wasted.



indeed, seen some vids about them in youtube and even that they are still 
pretty big, they are also very effective.


yeah it could be dangerous for humans to not just live there, but to have 
children. it will effect the future generations for them to evolve to this 
lower gravity and so they are never able to come to earth. what we need is 
artificial gravity to solve this kind of problems.
comments.author: MrAnimepredator

comments.text:
+MrAnimepredator in the case of miniature mechs i agree 100% that these 
have alot of potential. and yes i do laugh at government lack of space 
capability or nuclear power (that is public btw and not classified). and 
did you know there is a kid who made a really small fission reactor in his 
garage? it powers his families home and he was not even 18 at the time.(if 
we think about it our gov heard about this and probably got the kid to tell 
them the specs, so we may find it already and never know about it). 

but despite mechs awesome potential i believe the enhancing armor is the 
first step. building stuff like the armor in halo first. then creating 
mechs out of them.


and as for jets and rockets exiting planets, we have developed rail cannons 
and actual reliable laser weapons now so such tech will soon be irrelevent. 

its not really the atmosphere that determined thrusting away from something 
like mars, its the lower gravity constant.

comments.text:
+hypernerd the wolverine
after further considering it, it could be effective but not right now at 
least. the bigger ones arent effective because even that we have powerful 
energy sources (like the version of nuke reactor that actually uses one 
type or rock instead of plutonium, since its more common and more 
powerful(sadly its not in common use yet)) and even if we have technology. 
it would eventually be handed over to those who work for the government 
because of financial issues and it would never be finished because they 
work so slow, and even a guy who works in a garage can build a better robot 
than 100 scientists who work for the government. government wants immediate 
results and that is why everything is so slow and too safe. they cant even 
make one that can walk on its own. and there is titan, build by guys in 
their garage. and its better than anything government scientists have done 
so far.(its pretty amazing robot. look it up)

and smaller ones would be effective in city warfare and even on the wilds 
and on desert, for their ability to shoot even directly upwards and for 
their ability to fire immediately unlike tanks that have to first see you, 
tell guys to move the gun, and give a fire command, with small mech one guy 
can do that as fast as moving his own body. but joints are the problem. 
they can be secured pretty well from front, but because of their mobility, 
the back of the joint must be left pretty unprotected by armor so it can 
move. sure elastic material could be figured that can take stronger impacts 
and than joint could be wrapped in that. so it would be like super kevlar. 
tho if wrapped too tightly it protects only from cosmetic damage but still 
causes damage on impact. if let too loose it will hang and even cause 
damage to the joint if it goes between something. tho if filled like a 
balloon around it, it might work. no matter how silly it looks like.  

true, but why would you use it in space anyway. what we need for space 
warfare is 5 kilometer long space ship armed with weapons ready to wipe 
live from entire planets. these space ships should pretty much be build in 
space and than than filled with actual air. if they can build space 
stations that way than it should not be problem for the space ship.

where do we find raw material for all of this. well we need a new space 
program for starters. those missiles shoot directly towards sky 
are ridiculous and impractical. would think that their symbolic value has 
already disappeared. sure it worked on the first time and maybe on the 
second. but we live a year 2015, we should be smarter than try to shoot 
them directly towards sky. there is way to get them into space with out 
doing it directly pushing through air and gravity consuming massive amounts 
of energy.
instead we could do it like planes and fly them into space and when it gets 
too thin to fly, we drop the wings like booster rockets and start the 
actual rocket and start flying in space. minimal energy and fuel needed. 
why are scientists not seeing this.
but what can be expected when energy drink has a better space program than 
government (literally. red bull has better space program that US 
government) 
the resources to massive space ships could be got from planet mars, its is 
practically made of minerals. what gives its red color is rust. there is 
literally rocks of solid iron size of mans fist right on the surface. that 
planet could be start of space mining. and since there really isnt 
atmosphere, leaving from the planet doesnt require that must thrust.

but so called dark age of technology will not come anytime soon because we 
live age of consuming and will probably destroy this planet before we get 
over it.
comments.author: MrAnimepredator

comments.text: +MrAnimepredator this guy would be probably a Tau player.
comments.author: Hiperforteca

comments.text:
+MrAnimepredator logistics would make it extremely hard and even more 
expensive for just one of those things to be made given advances in tech 
were made overnight. but with even such weaponry we do have missles and 
rail cannons that can blast through its armor way before it can even see 
them coming. you can armor up all you want, but like all robots, the one 
fatal weakness is the joints. shield the intake? sure, fission reactors 
were better anyway with the water cooling and such, but most of the tech 
you speak of pretty much sums up the tech in modern cruisers.

 plus, in reality the damn thing would be slow, it takes alot of power to 
move an arm alone, imagine supporting the entire body and powering the 
electronics that keep it balanced and charge such a powerful arm cannon. 
since the reactor would be known for high yield sure thats achievable but 
at a fatal cost. such high power output requires an impossible cooling 
system to keep it from having a melt down. and its dangerous to have those 
reactors at just 50% power. so you would be forced to keep it slow. but let 
me stress the weight issue. look at godzilla, the support needed to keep 
him on his feet would crush solid modern rebar supported concrete, the 
toughest supporting substance we know and use. 

however cool it is, logistics says there is no way in hell such a thing 
would be practical on a planetary body.even in space its unpractical, for 
every movement the robot would make would imply newtons laws of motion an 
make the robot go into chaotic spins in zero gee gravity.

 thats why we invest our super-heavy defense projects on either naval 
craft, aircraft, or in the future, spacecraft. no limbs to mess with, just 
one solid mass covered in guns and armor.
comments.author: hypernerd the wolverine

comments.text:
+hypernerd the wolverine not with a proper shield and not to mention that 
you dont make them out of plastic. not to mention that the controls should 
be direct, and I dont mean pulling switches or even the way they did in 
pacific rim. I mean direct physical bond with the machine. in order to move 
the god machine, you must become one with the war engine. direct plug from 
the brain into the machines brain, you move the machine directly as you 
would move your self (you move the machine instead of jumping around in the 
cock pit) the smaller more mobile mechs do the scouting and support of the 
bigger ones who are not as mobile. but machine of 150 meters tall is real 
god of war. it only has 3 enemies: folly, hubris, and another of its own 
kind. 
a legion of mech can bring any planet to its knees.
even if they would be able to take down the smaller ones, the bigger ones 
will annihilate the enemy where they stand. they are not supposed to do 
karate kicks. they are supposed to bring death with heavy weapons. for they 
are weapons. walking fortresses of war.
and like tanks there is drivers, commander and shooters. all linked 
physically into the machine. with them there is mechanics and nurses. any 
member of the crew can take control of a bigger area of the mech if other 
driver cant do it anymore for reason or another. 
not to mention that taking down one with todays weapons would be 
practically impossible for none could pierce its armor.

comments.author: MrAnimepredator

comments.text:
Bipedal giant mechs are pointless, the future of warfare is in space. And 
why have two mechs fight when you can have a su-25 or f-18 Fire maybe one 
missile into the robots huge ass reactor intake turbine? I say the fighters 
in the movie not only were slow, but also fly retardedly close the monster. 
No pilot would be that stupid. Use the Gatlings and sidewinders to blind 
it. Then bombard it with strikes in the openings(mouth, eye socket, 
nostril). And we would have lasers at that time so it could just burn holes 
through the monsters organs. 

Mechs-cool but unpractical even in a perfect world where it's tech is fully 
possible and applied.
